00001 #include <mm/phys_mm.h>
00002 #include <mm/virt_mm.h>
00003 #include <debug/debug.h>
00004 #include <multiboot.h>
00005 #include <panic/panic.h>
00006 #include <types/memory.h>
00007 
00008 MEM_LOC used_mem_end = 0;
00009 
00010 MEM_LOC phys_mm_slock = PHYS_MM_STACK_ADDR;
00011 MEM_LOC phys_mm_smax = PHYS_MM_STACK_ADDR;
00012 
00013 extern uint32 paging_enabled;
00014 
00015 void init_phys_mm(MEM_LOC start) 
00016 {
00017         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Used memory end 0x");
00018         DEBUG_PRINTX(start);
00019         DEBUG_PRINT("\n");
00020 
00021         used_mem_end = (start + 0x1000) & PAGE_MASK; //This ensures that the used_mem_end address is on a page-aligned boundry (Which it has to be if I wish to identity map from 0 to used_mem_end)
00022 }
00023 
00024 MEM_LOC allocateFrame() 
00025 {
00026         if (paging_enabled == 0) 
00027         {
00028                 used_mem_end += 4096; //Add 4096 bytes (4kb) to used_mem_end address
00029                 return used_mem_end - 4096; //Return the old address
00030                 //The reason why this works is that all memory up to used_mem_end is identity mapped when paging is enabled
00031                 //This meens that when paging is enabled the address will be mapped directly to the physical address (0x1000 will still access 0x1000 in memory for example) 
00032         } 
00033         else 
00034         {
00035 
00036                 //Paging is enabled     
00037                 if (phys_mm_slock == PHYS_MM_STACK_ADDR)
00038                 {
00039                         DEBUG_PRINT("Out of physical frames of memory\n");
00040                         return 0; //Frame 0 should never be free
00041                 }
00042 
00043                 // Pop off the stack.
00044                 phys_mm_slock -= sizeof (uint32);
00045 
00046                 uint32 * stack = (uint32 *)phys_mm_slock;
00047 
00048                 if (get_current_process() != 0)
00049                 {
00050                         used_list_add(get_current_process(), *stack);
00051                 }
00052 
00053                 return *stack;
00054         }
00055 }
00056 
00057 MEM_LOC allocateFrameForProcess(process_t* req_process) 
00058 {
00059         if (paging_enabled == 0) 
00060         {
00061                 used_mem_end += 4096; //Add 4096 bytes (4kb) to used_mem_end address
00062                 return used_mem_end - 4096; //Return the old address
00063                 //The reason why this works is that all memory up to used_mem_end is identity mapped when paging is enabled
00064                 //This meens that when paging is enabled the address will be mapped directly to the physical address (0x1000 will still access 0x1000 in memory for example) 
00065         } 
00066         else 
00067         {
00068 
00069                 //Paging is enabled     
00070                 if (phys_mm_slock == PHYS_MM_STACK_ADDR)
00071                 {
00072                         DEBUG_PRINT("Out of physical frames of memory\n");
00073                         return 0; //Frame 0 should never be free
00074                 }
00075 
00076                 // Pop off the stack.
00077                 phys_mm_slock -= sizeof (uint32);
00078 
00079                 uint32 * stack = (uint32 *)phys_mm_slock;
00080 
00081                 if (req_process != 0)
00082                 {
00083                         used_list_add(req_process, *stack);
00084                 }
00085 
00086                 return *stack;
00087         }
00088 }
00089 
00090 void freeFrame(MEM_LOC frame) 
00091 {
00092         if (paging_enabled == 0) 
00093         {
00094                 return; //If paging isn't enabled we are not going to be able to free a frame of virtual memory and the stacks location is virtual (Cannot be accessed without paging)  
00095         }       
00096 
00097         if (frame < used_mem_end + PAGE_SIZE) 
00098         {
00099                 return; //Anything under used_mem_end is identity mapped (Physical Address == Virtual Address) never remap it.
00100         }
00101 
00102         if (get_current_process() != 0)
00103         {
00104                 used_list_remove(get_current_process(), frame);
00105         }
00106 
00107         if (phys_mm_smax <= phys_mm_slock) //Run out of stack space *Shock Horror* Allocate this frame to the end of the stack (Giving another 4kb (4096 bytes) of stack space)
00108         {
00109             map ((POINTER) phys_mm_smax, (POINTER) frame, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00110             phys_mm_smax += PAGE_SIZE;
00111         
00112         }
00113         else
00114         {
00115                 //We still have stack space left to pop to,
00116                 MEM_LOC* stack = ((POINTER)phys_mm_slock);
00117                 *stack = frame;
00118                 phys_mm_slock += sizeof(uint32);        
00119         }
00120 }
00121 
00122 //Does the initialization of the free pages using the memory map provided by the mboot header.
00123 void map_free_pages(struct multiboot * mboot_ptr) 
00124 {
00125 
00126   uint32 i = mboot_ptr->mmap_addr;
00127   uint32 dbiter = 0;
00128 
00129   while (i < mboot_ptr->mmap_addr + mboot_ptr->mmap_length)
00130   {
00131     mmap_entry_t *me = (mmap_entry_t*) i;
00132     
00133     // Does this entry specify usable RAM?
00134     if (me->type == 1)
00135     {
00136 
00137       uint32 j;
00138 
00139       // For every page in this entry, add to the free page stack.
00140       for (j = me->base_addr_low; j < me->base_addr_low+me->length_low; j += 0x1000)
00141       {
00142         freeFrame(j);
00143         dbiter++;
00144       }
00145 
00146     }
00147 
00148     // The multiboot specification is strange in this respect - the size member does not include "size" itself in its calculations,
00149     // so we must add sizeof a 32bit int
00150     i += me->size + sizeof (uint32);
00151   }
00152 
00153   DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Map Free Pages finished with 0x");
00154   DEBUG_PRINTX(dbiter);
00155   DEBUG_PRINT(" 4096 bytes of mapped memory\n"); 
00156 }

00158 extern void asm_copy_frame(uint32 src, uint32 dest);
00159 
00160 void copy_frame(uint32 phys_addr_src, uint32 phys_addr_dest) 
00161 {
00162         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Copying 0x");
00163         DEBUG_PRINTX(phys_addr_src);
00164 
00165         DEBUG_PRINT(" to 0x");
00166         DEBUG_PRINTX(phys_addr_dest);
00167 
00168         DEBUG_PRINT("\n");
00169 
00170         asm_copy_frame(phys_addr_src, phys_addr_dest);
00171 }
00172 
00173 MEM_LOC calculate_free_frames()
00174 {
00175         return ((phys_mm_slock - PHYS_MM_STACK_ADDR) / sizeof(MEM_LOC));
00176 }
